page.title: 04'Old' Wives Tales ?
page.content: Old Women's Institute had an interesting talk on{" Country Cures". Some of the remedies descibed,such as {Digitalis (Foxglove)}for heart trouble and{Penicillin-type mould}on bread for wounds,have the approval of modern scientific thought. A cure for earache described was to pour hot{Hedgehog Fat }in the ear. This had been tried by a member of the W.I. in their younger days and had proved beneficial--for the person but not for the hedgehog !! If ladies take to carrying{Acorns}in their pockets it is because that keeps wrinkles at bay,and putting {Pansy {leaves}in salads ensures that their menfolk do not suffer from any unseemly lusts.(The origin of the term {"pansy"}when used in the non-horticultural sense perhaps!)
